dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Congress has just 30 days to put together that sixth coronavirus stimulus package before the August recess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Congress has just thirty days to put together that sixth coronavirus stimulus package before the August recess.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Congress is readying for a frantic push to come together on a fifth coronavirus stimulus package with just 11 days to act before lawmakers break for August recess and as the U.S. continues to break records for new daily cases.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the Washington Post is reporting the Biden administration is pushing for billions more in funding for testing and the CDC.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the Washington Post is reporting the Biden administration is pushing for billions more in funding for testing and the C D C.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As Congress races to come together on a fifth coronavirus stimulus package with cases skyrocketing across the country, the Trump administration is actively working to block billions of dollars in federal funding for testing and the Centers for Disease Control, according to a new report from the Washington Post.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, but uh, GOP senators are apparently not on board with that part of the proposal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, but uh, G O P senators are apparently not on board with that part of the proposal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The White House request has reportedly angered GOP senators, and some Republicans have pushed back, adamant the funding should stay in the bill.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's interesting though, because Biden's been really vocal about supporting the CDC lately— he even backed Robert Redfield's mask guidance last week.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's interesting though, because Biden's been really vocal about supporting the C D C lately- he even backed Robert Redfield's mask guidance last week.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And they gave the CDC more control over data, which feels like a pretty significant shift.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they gave the C D C more control over data, which feels like a pretty significant shift.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Post report comes as Trump continues to swipe at the CDC: on Friday, the president said he doesnt agree with the CDC director Robert Redfields mask guidance and earlier, the Trump administration stripped the agency of control over coronavirus data and blocked Redfield from testifying to Congress on school reopenings.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, Treasury Secretary Mnuchin wants to cut the $600 unemployment boost and skip new stimulus checks entirely.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, Treasury Secretary Mnuchin wants to cut the six hundred dollars unemployment boost and skip new stimulus checks entirely.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin is pressing for another round of stimulus checks and even extending some variation of the $600 expanded unemployment program in a next bill, while other administration officials want to work around the edges with proposals like a payroll tax holiday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That's gonna be a tough sell for a lot of people, especially with so many still out of work.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's gonna be a tough sell for a lot of people, especially with so many still out of work.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And then there's this push for a payroll tax holiday— it feels like the administration isn't totally unified here.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there's this push for a payroll tax holiday- it feels like the administration isn't totally unified here.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Trump administration has sent mixed messages about its priorities for a fifth package, part of an epic clash occurring in the White House, Fox Business reported this week.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: You know, it's wild— we started with a testing shortage, now some are saying we actually have a surplus.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You know, it's wild- we started with a testing shortage, now some are saying we actually have a surplus.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Mick Mulvaney wrote an op-ed this week arguing exactly that— said we don't have a testing problem anymore.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mick Mulvaney wrote an op-ed this week arguing exactly that- said we don't have a testing problem anymore.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Former White House Chief of Staff Mick Mulvaney penned an op-ed in CNBC this week in which he argued the U.S. still has a testing problem.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But then you see reports about labs still struggling with backlogs… it's confusing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then you see reports about labs still struggling with backlogs... it's confusing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Now, the main problem appears to be a backlog at labs across the country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And Senate Republicans want to exclude $25 billion for testing and tracing, according to the Post.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Senate Republicans want to exclude twenty five dollars billion for testing and tracing, according to the Post.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: $25 billion. The amount of money Senate Republicans want to include for testing and contact tracing, according to the Washington Post.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which is the same amount that was approved back in April— so, like, where did that money go?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is the same amount that was approved back in April- so, like, where did that money go?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Post reports that some White House officials believe money approved for testing has been unspent (the coronavirus spending package passed in April included $25 billion for testing.)

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And Schumer's out here saying nobody's talking, even though they've been asking for details for weeks.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And Schumer's out here saying nobody's talking, even though they've been asking for details for weeks.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We have not heard a peep from McConnell or the Republicans or the administration on any proposal, even though we've been asking for weeks and weeks and weeks, Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.) said on a conference call Friday about the GOP stimulus bill, CNN reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It just feels like everyone's negotiating through the media instead of actually sitting down together.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It just feels like everyone's negotiating through the media instead of actually sitting down together.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and with only a month to go, the clock is definitely ticking.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and with only a month to go, the clock is definitely ticking.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Congress is readying for a frantic push to come together on a fifth coronavirus stimulus package with just 11 days to act before lawmakers break for August recess and as the U.S. continues to break records for new daily cases.

artist_script:
HostA: Congress has just 30 days to put together that sixth coronavirus stimulus package before the August recess.
HostB: Yeah, and the Washington Post is reporting the Biden administration is pushing for billions more in funding for testing and the CDC.
HostA: Right, but uh, GOP senators are apparently not on board with that part of the proposal.
HostB: It’s interesting though, because Biden’s been really vocal about supporting the CDC lately— he even backed Robert Redfield’s mask guidance last week.
HostA: And they gave the CDC more control over data, which feels like a pretty significant shift.
HostB: Meanwhile, Treasury Secretary Mnuchin wants to cut the $600 unemployment boost and skip new stimulus checks entirely.
HostA: That’s gonna be a tough sell for a lot of people, especially with so many still out of work.
HostB: And then there’s this push for a payroll tax holiday— it feels like the administration isn’t totally unified here.
HostA: You know, it’s wild— we started with a testing shortage, now some are saying we actually have a surplus.
HostB: Mick Mulvaney wrote an op-ed this week arguing exactly that— said we don’t have a testing problem anymore.
HostA: But then you see reports about labs still struggling with backlogs… it’s confusing.
HostB: And Senate Republicans want to exclude $25 billion for testing and tracing, according to the Post.
HostA: Which is the same amount that was approved back in April— so, like, where did that money go?
HostB: Exactly. And Schumer’s out here saying nobody’s talking, even though they’ve been asking for details for weeks.
HostA: It just feels like everyone’s negotiating through the media instead of actually sitting down together.
HostB: Yeah, and with only a month to go, the clock is definitely ticking.
